column4: quick question - I changed my hard drives around (physically), where do i edit my grub menu to stop pointing windows from SDD to SDA ? What file i mean, i'm in 10.10
you could just set teh bios to boot the other hd.. and it may work properly.
and rerun 'sudo update-grub' after you boot into linuix
ahh it auto-detected it on update-grub
i still have an old entry for an old windows on grub menu, how can i remove that?
proberly can. but i rarely bother. :)
yeah i got 4 hard drives, so, old entries around one of them. I can live with it, but was just wondering.
oh, i did forget to thank you btw :)
why do you think you need one?
i have not seen a need for the identd in years.....
i figured that. No, i was just curious, it's been a *very* long time for me since i used Linux.
but thanks, i'll live without it too then.

Don't mind noob questions. Curious question - i see my used RAM at bootup (not cached/buffered) start at 400-410MB. After few hours jumps to 500, 1 day after it's 700+ (even after log on). Is that normal?
its using it as cache for the disk
hit google for 'linux ate my ram' for a site that details it.
ok will do, thanks.
i meant my free (minus cached/Buffers)
Ahh, i read play.html (second page), gotcha :)
curious, what do you use as your android phone?
samsung captivate.
that is a good question by s7r, is there an undelete utility for EXTx ?
theres tools for that.. good luck getting any actual data recovered.. :)
